item.description:
Meet up at the Liberty Hotel in The Yard for drinks and/or a movie. FREE film with complimentary popcorn and pop chips as well as cash bar with movie candy for sale.

As always, get there when you can and stay as long or short as you're able.

The weather for the past Monday evenings has been ideal to be outside and hang out in this cool setting...enjoying the company of friendly fun folks. The movie begins close to 8 PM.

This evenings film is Forgotten Ellis Island, a documentary which explores the medical wing of America's most famous (and infamous) immigration depot. Though most Americans know the story of the island, the documentary seeks to go beyond the usual borders of history and talk about the island's hospitals, which dealt with a wide variety of diseases as well as perceived mental illnesses.
Narrated by actor, Elliot Gould

Get on the guest list by emailing moviemondays@libertyhotel.com

Event Flyer

Courtyard Menu

Cocktail Menu

Check out MBTA or Hop Stop to create your route by public transit. Charles/MGH (red line) is the closest subway station and steps away. Government (green & blue lines) subway station is less than a ten (10) minute walk.

PLEASE MAINTAIN YOUR OWN TAB OR PAY AS YOU ORDER - THANK YOU
item.how_to_find_us: I am NOT able to make it. So how will you find each other...hmmmmm. Suggest sitting in the middle seats to the left (facing screen) as you enter the courtyard.
item.name: Drinks and/or a Movie at Liberty Hotel - Monday July 26th
